OOC: Yo, be forewarned of the curse. Cybertron lacks any fun what so ever. =
And it's a place I'm definitely never moving my characters to, even if I'm =
the only person with characters left on Earth...

  ----- Original Message =
----- 
  From: KSLawdogg@... 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wedn=
esday, November 21, 2001 3:09 PM
  Subject: Re: Debate (important everyone =
read)


  (Going to Cybertron would be cool.  If an RPG died because of it =
would be 
  because no one wanted to go Cybertron (obvious there) or becaus=
e it wasn't 
  done right.  Cybertron isn't really explored that much in th=
e American 
  Transformers cartoon, which is the only one I've seen.  I'd a=
gree with LN, 
  don't base it on Beast Machines.  Yuk.  

  Also, on Cyber=
tron, we could do more stuff.  In example, the first two 
  seasons of TFs,=
 undoubtedly the best but I guess you could say 'restricted' 
  to Earth an=
d occassional visits to Earth.  Season three, undoubtedly not the 
  best, =
did have many episodes OFF of Cybertron and Earth.  Going to different 
  p=
lanets, etc.  A good concept there, even if most art and writing was...shal=
l 
  we say lacking?  Again, season three wasn't the best but it had a LOT =
of 
  opportunities that this RPG would have as well.  Not to mention we'd =
get to 
  make our own Cybertron and, well, yeah, I went over that.

  The =
biggest problem is we'd have to make our own Cybertron.  I mean, we know 
 =
 what Earth looks like, all the places, the geography.  Buuuut, we don't kn=
ow 
  that for Cybertron and we'd need to create it.

  As for the protohum=
ans, early in the RPG people were equipping huge gumby 
  squads of protohu=
mans with weapons and using them as massively destructive 
  armies so they=
 were banned, as they should be.  The RPG's got along fine with 
  gumbies =
that can't fight.


  -L. Unitron   

   

  Your use of Yahoo! Groups is s=
ubject to http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
